description:
When using the OS API, the state of an instance is generally just ACTIVE or BUILD. "BUILD" is hiding a lot of different
situations - using the EC2 API you can see pending, terminating, networking, ... 

We need this additional state to be surfaced in the OS API also.
title: os api needs to return more info than just build

comments.content:
I absolutely agree with this. Temporarily, you might be able to look at the extended status extension available in the openstack api. 

I would love to see a flow of statuses you would expect to see during a boot operation. I can work with you to get them into the OpenStack API spec.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~bcwaldon

comments.content: It's been well over a year since this was opened, so it looks like nobody has wanted this bad enough to work on it yet.  I'm going to transition the bug to "Opinion / Wishlist" state.  I also linked this bug to the nova-v3-api blueprint so that it is considered by those looking at the next version of the OpenStack API.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~russellb

comments.content: Actually ... I think this is pretty much already covered with the task state.  While in BUILD, the task state will go through scheduling, block_device_mapping, networking, spawning ... so I think we're good here.
